lights-hud-ate.setting.position.name: Token Position
lights-hud-ate.setting.position.hint: Which side of the token should the icons appear on?
lights-hud-ate.setting.imageDisplay.name: Display as Image?
lights-hud-ate.setting.imageDisplay.hint: Display all the "lighting" items on the actor with images in the HUD.
lights-hud-ate.setting.opacity.name: Opacity of token preview
lights-hud-ate.setting.opacity.hint: MConfigure the opacity of the token previews in the HUD before hovering on them.
lights-hud-ate.setting.rollItem.name: Roll the item when enable the light/vision ?
lights-hud-ate.setting.rollItem.hint: When you left click on a light hud element if the light/vision is not already enabled it will ask to roll the item.
lights-hud-ate.setting.enableHud.name: CV HUD element
lights-hud-ate.setting.enableHud.hint: If checked it will enable the hud button for apply lights and visions
lights-hud-ate.setting.enableHudOnlyGM.h: If 'CV HUD element' is enabled, will enable the hud button for apply lights and visions, but only for GM's
lights-hud-ate.setting.hudColumn.name: HUD Column
lights-hud-ate.setting.hudColumn.hint: Which HUD column to place the button in
lights-hud-ate.setting.hudTopBottom.name: HUD Top/Bottom
lights-hud-ate.setting.hudTopBottom.hint: Where to place the button in the column
lights-hud-ate.setting.applyOnATEItem.na: Apply HUD interface on ATE Items
lights-hud-ate.setting.applyOnATEItem.hi: Show all actor items with ATE active effect in the HUD interface
lights-hud-ate.setting.showATEFromNoItem: Show all ATE active effect applied on the actor with no item on the origin in the HUD interface. Attention this can made show duplicate lights and vision
lights-hud-ate.setting.applyOnFlagItem.n: Apply HUD interface on flagged Items
lights-hud-ate.setting.applyOnFlagItem.h: Show all actor items flagged from this module active effect in the HUD interface
lights-hud-ate.setting.useMetricSystem.n: Use metric system on preset light and vision
lights-hud-ate.setting.useMetricSystem.h: If enabled the unit distance used on the preset light and vision is converted to metric system
lights-hud-ate.setting.skipDialogLightHU: If enabled no dialog will pop out when click on lights and vision on the LightHUD
lights-hud-ate.setting.tempEffectsAsStat: When a token has a temporary active effect active, display that active effect icon in the Status Effects HUD element.
Temporary Effects as Token Statuses: Always delete instead of disable
If 'Temporary Effects as Token Statuses' is enabled, instead of disabling some effects and deleting others, always delete a temporary effect toggled from the status menu.
lights-hud-ate.setting.enableLightHUDOld: For people who want the literally 1:1 same interface of the old LightsHUD you can enable this. Usually this will work better with 'Apply HUD interface on ATE Items' and 'Apply HUD interface on flagged Items' module setting disabled, but they can kind work together
lights-hud-ate.setting.autoApplyEffectIf: Auto apply effect if not present on actor

If enabled this setting will automatically applied a retrieve effect on a item but absent on the actor, this is usually useful for force the player to not remove some effect and force the gm to go every time to apply the 'transferToActor' feature on the item
lights-hud-ate.setting.reset.name: Reset settings to default
lights-hud-ate.setting.reset.label: Reset Settings To Default
lights-hud-ate.setting.reset.hint: This will reset all of the settings of back to the active game system's default.
lights-hud-ate.setting.debug.name: Enable debugging
lights-hud-ate.setting.debug.label: Prints debug messages to the console
lights-hud-ate.effect.not-reflected: Item Effect Saved. These changes will not be reflected in the originally transferred Effect.
lights-hud-ate.effect.not-transferred: Item Effect Saved. Setting an owned item's effect to Transfer will not automatically transfer the Effect.

This vision is used from the module 'LightHUD+ATE'
lights-hud-ate.visions.blinded.name: Blinded
lights-hud-ate.visions.blinded.descripti:
A blinded creature can't see and automatically fails any ability check that requires sight.
Attack rolls against the creature have advantage, and the creature's attack rolls have disadvantage.

A blinded creature can't see and automatically fails any ability check that requires sight.
Attack rolls against the creature have advantage, and the creature's attack rolls have disadvantage.
lights-hud-ate.visions.darkvision.name: Darkvision
lights-hud-ate.visions.darkvision.descri: A monster with Darkvision can see in the dark within a specific radius. The monster can see in dim light within the radius as if it were bright light, and in Darkness as if it were dim light. The monster can't discern color in Darkness, only Shades of Gray. Many Creatures that live Underground have this Special sense.

A monster with Darkvision can see in the dark within a radius of {number}. The monster can see in dim light within the radius as if it were bright light, and in Darkness as if it were dim light. The monster can't discern color in Darkness, only Shades of Gray. Many Creatures that live Underground have this Special sense.
lights-hud-ate.visions.tremorsense.name: Tremor Sense
lights-hud-ate.visions.tremorsense.descr: A monster with tremorsense can detect and pinpoint the origin of vibrations within a specific radius, provided that the monster and the source of the vibrations are in contact with the same ground or substance. Tremorsense can't be used to detect flying or incorporeal creatures. Many burrowing creatures, such as ankhegs and umber hulks, have this special sense.

A monster with tremorsense can detect and pinpoint the origin of vibrations within a radius of {number}, provided that the monster and the source of the vibrations are in contact with the same ground or substance. Tremorsense can't be used to detect flying or incorporeal creatures. Many burrowing creatures, such as ankhegs and umber hulks, have this special sense.
lights-hud-ate.visions.seeinvisible.name: See invisible
See invisible ({number})
lights-hud-ate.visions.seeinvisible.desc: For the duration, you see invisible creatures and objects as if they were visible, and you can see into the Ethereal Plane. Ethereal creatures and objects appear ghostly and translucent.

For the duration, you see invisible creatures and objects as if they were visible within a radius of {number}, and you can see into the Ethereal Plane. Ethereal creatures and objects appear ghostly and translucent.
lights-hud-ate.visions.blindsight.name: Blind Sight
lights-hud-ate.visions.blindsight.descri:
A monster with blindsight can perceive its surroundings without relying on sight, within a specific radius.
Creatures without eyes, such as grimlocks and gray oozes, typically have this special sense, as do creatures with echolocation or heightened senses, such as bats and true dragons.
If a monster is naturally blind, it has a parenthetical note to this effect, indicating that the radius of its blindsight defines the maximum range of its perception.

A monster with blindsight can perceive its surroundings without relying on sight, within a radius of {number}.
Creatures without eyes, such as grimlocks and gray oozes, typically have this special sense, as do creatures with echolocation or heightened senses, such as bats and true dragons.
If a monster is naturally blind, it has a parenthetical note to this effect, indicating that the radius of its blindsight defines the maximum range of its perception.
lights-hud-ate.visions.truesight.name: True Sight
lights-hud-ate.visions.truesight.descrip: A monster with truesight can, out to a specific range, see in normal and magical darkness, see invisible creatures and objects, automatically detect visual illusions and succeed on saving throws against them, and perceive the original form of a shapechanger or a creature that is transformed by magic. Furthermore, the monster can see into the Ethereal Plane within the same range.

Within a radius of {number} a monster with truesight can, out to a specific range, see in normal and magical darkness, see invisible creatures and objects, automatically detect visual illusions and succeed on saving throws against them, and perceive the original form of a shapechanger or a creature that is transformed by magic. Furthermore, the monster can see into the Ethereal Plane within the same range.
lights-hud-ate.visions.devilssight.name: Devil's sight
lights-hud-ate.visions.devilssight.descr: You can see normally in darkness, both magical and nonmagical, to a certain distance.
You can see normally in darkness, both magical and nonmagical, to a distance of {number}.
lights-hud-ate.visions.lowlightvision.de: A creature with low-light vision can see in dim light as though it were bright light, so it ignores the concealed condition due to dim light.
Within a radius of {number} a creature with low-light vision can see in dim light as though it were bright light, so it ignores the concealed condition due to dim light.
lights-hud-ate.visions.greaterdarkvision: A creature with darkvision or greater darkvision can see perfectly well in areas of darkness and dim light, though such vision is in black and white only. Some forms of magical darkness, such as a 4th-level darkness spell, block normal darkvision. A creature with greater darkvision, however, can see through even these forms of magical darkness.

Within a radius of {number} a creature with darkvision or greater darkvision can see perfectly well in areas of darkness and dim light, though such vision is in black and white only. Some forms of magical darkness, such as a 4th-level darkness spell, block normal darkvision. A creature with greater darkvision, however, can see through even these forms of magical darkness.

lights-hud-ate.dialogs.resetsettings.con: Are you sure you want to reset all of the module settings to the current system's defaults? THIS CANNOT BE UNDONE!
lights-hud-ate.dialogs.nosystemfound.con:
This system is not currently fully supported. This means that the module does not know how to best handle this system's items, but can still operate in a limited fashion.

You can configure the module's settings yourself, but it requires a bit of technical know-how.

If you have any questions, ping Wasp#2005 on the Foundry discord.
lights-hud-ate.dialogs.systemfound.title: System Recognized
lights-hud-ate.dialogs.systemfound.conte:
This system was previously not supported, but in an recent update it was added as a supported system!

Do you want to load this system's default Item Pile settings?
lights-hud-ate.note.label: LightHUD Note
lights-hud-ate.note.isATEActive.label1: NOTE: You can use this form to create a ATE effect on the item. BUT ONLY IF YOU EXPLICITLY check the Apply as 'ATE/ATL Effect' checkbox
lights-hud-ate.note.isATEActive.label2: NOTE: The modules is not smart enough to distinct multiple lighting effect on the same item and is not make sense ? Every item must have only one effect with _ATL changes_ on it (at least for me). If multiple effect with _ATL changes_ are founded on the same item only the first is analyzed from the module, you can use multiple item where each has is own lighting configuration.
